storyInfo: Thiago is the protector of his homeland, and he finally bares his fangs at the cultists who would destroy his home. The High Inquisitor fights to the bitter end, and the chaotic hunt aboard the Stultifera has only just begun.

attributes.content: Pick up the pace!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: This... nethersea brand. What exactly is it?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Though tiny and varying in form, these fluorescent lifeforms are also an extension of our kin.
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: The Prophet once said there's a part of the ocean where these glowing creatures fill the entire sea. They are the Whole, and they shape the cradle of life for our kin.
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: The 'nethersea brand' is just fragments of His will from tens of thousands of nautical miles away, washed in like the tide. Even a tiny amount will inevitably consume the land.
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: It will turn the land into a new kind of ocean.
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: ...Indeed.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: So Iberia was the first sacrifice for your plans, and Gran Faro is the next.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Sacrifice? Surely you're using the wrong word?
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: The Inquisition will take away my town. And this 'beautiful' nethersea brand will do the same.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Either way it's no longer our home. It'll lose its history, its golden years of explosive growth and vitality.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Thiago, surely you don't mean—
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: Jordi has been taken away as well. The ones who escaped have probably all been rounded up by the Penal Battalion by now.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: You're all murderers.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: — (Screeches excitedly)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Mon3tr?!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Why would it show up here?! Impossible! It was just on the west side of town—!
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: You lied to us, Thiago!
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: And you too?!
attributes.name: Torturer Cultist

attributes.content: Before becoming an Inquisition spy, I was just the daughter of an ordinary Gran Faro laborer.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: Don't underestimate our hatred. All the humiliation we've endured was just to take you all down.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: Both you lot and the Inquisition are nothing more than enemies trampling over our home.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: See for yourself what real destruction looks like. See for yourself what we saw back then.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Thiago! Get down!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Ugh!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: (Screeches)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: There's nothing left to tinker with. Everything else is out of power...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: All that remains is to see how long this lighthouse can hold out.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: (The nethersea brand has already reached this floor?)
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I'll have to keep climbing higher.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: High Inquisitor...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: His arms have gone numb.
The shape of the reef has already changed dramatically. The High Inquisitor spares no effort when annihilating all enemies in his sight.
But his enemies are quite literally endless.
His sword is corroded, and he's expended his roll of explosives.
Only the flame in his lantern burns even brighter than before.
Not once does Dario look behind him, to the lighthouse he has defended from the beginning.
He looks beyond the sea's horizon.
Creatures of the sea, Iberia will not be destroyed by you.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Humanity will not be destroyed by you.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: He hacks up the blood stuck in his throat. A metallic scent fills his nostrils.
(Slow slithering sounds)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: And I, too, will not be destroyed by you. That would take more than death.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Be patient and wait here, Garcia.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Squats beside the captain obediently)
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: It's always boring, waiting for our quarry to take the bait.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Still remember the second time we went to hunt these monsters? We still had over a hundred survivors back then.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: When we first set sail, the air was filled with cheering and salutes from the cannons. Those sounds still echo in our ears to this day. We bid farewell to the grand shore, carrying the legends of Ægir as we sprinted towards the depths.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: After a few days at sea—yes, only a few days—calamity struck.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Graaah... Why did these stupid goddamn cells rob you of your language?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: How I wish to chat with you again, rather than those stupid, rancid idiots who took over sixty years to get here!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: (Rubs Alfonso's hand in sorrow)
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Good day, Mister Captain.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Oh, we just happened to be short some bait. Fancy a dip? Considering you're an Ægir, after all.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: What? Already forgotten what I said?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Either you leave, or I toss you overboard.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: It's a miracle you survived. I never thought any Iberians would've made it after all this time.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: That's got nothing to do with you, or with Iberia. After sixty years, the only thing I belong to is this ship.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: But, we—
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Let me give it a try, Skadi.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: How goes the hunt?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Maybe my extremely cordial attitude has stoked a number of misunderstandings. But I can tell that the blood of monsters flows in your veins, just like me.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: We're... the same?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You, us, and your chief mate too?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...Who gave you permission to talk about Garcia? Who gave you permission to LOOK at my Garcia, you filthy Ægir mongrels?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: I never told you what Garcia used to be. You don't know if they were a man or a woman, tall or short, fat or skinny, Perro or devil.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: But know that Garcia is my chief mate and my lover, and I will never reveal their former self to outsiders.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: We don't need your pity, or a comparison to whatever image of us you might have from the past. Neither of us need any of that.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: What a joke. Hunters whose blood is mixed with that of their prey. Not even the ocean's waves can wash away your filth, yet you dare bare your fangs in front of us?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Skadi's brows furrow into a frown. She rarely cares about what others have to say, especially land-dwellers. But the words coming from the exception in front of her make her feel uncomfortable.
The chief mate shoots a sharp glance at Skadi. It is a warning.
But, we need your help.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...What do you call these monsters again? Sea-something?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Oh, 'Seaborn.'
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Okay, so why should we help you Seaborn? Do you know how many good lads lost their lives to the sea after the calamity?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: You float around on these waters and refuse to return to port, yet still insist that you're an enemy of the sea?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Yup. That's my life.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: We are... Abyssal Hunters. We come from Ægir, and while we can only guess how exactly you survived, we have nothing but respect for you.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: We also hope you'll understand that everything we do is to fight against those enemies.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: And I should care about what Ægir does, why?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Er, no, you misunderstand.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Skadi shoots a glance at Specter beside her. When she'd said 'let me give it a try,' Skadi thought she meant that she'd be better at negotiating.
But drawing her weapon should absolutely not be a part of 'negotiations.'
Let me rephrase that. It's our job to slaughter them. And I happen to find that process rather enjoyable.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Since you're only hunting for food, I can leave you some of the meat when I'm done. After all, I've never liked dealing with that nauseating stuff.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You... think pretty highly of yourselves, eh? Compared to the Victorians, or Leithanians? I've seen the way you kill Seaborn. You aren't worth a damn thing.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Oh, don't get us wrong, dealing with these low-level creatures we call Sea Terrors doesn't even count as combat for the 2nd Company. Gladiia isn't exactly the stingy type either.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I'm stronger than you. That's just an indisputable fact.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Hraagh...!
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: My, let's not get ahead of ourselves, Mister Chief Mate. Or, Miss? Anyway, it's not your turn yet.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...Lay a finger on Garcia, and you're dead.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Oh really?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Since our captain's mission is to retrieve this ship and return to Ægir, we don't have the luxury of sitting around trying to convince you.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: This way's always been the more straightforward means of communication—the Hunters' way.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Hah, you've got a death wish!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Kin, I've come for you.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: To hunt and consume, is an important matter.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You, are not all kin. But I know, you can still return to our kind.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: So I ask, what will you do?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Piss off!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso & Specter

attributes.content: Hah, now there's an easy way to prove that you're not a Seaborn. Kill it. Unless you're unwilling to attack your 'kin.'
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Then I sincerely hope that you won't drag me down.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I'm more worried about you showing mercy to your twisted 'kin,' Ægir.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Then you worry over nothing. After all, if I really was on their side, you'd be dead already.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: So, once I prove I'm not one of them, are you willing to lend us your ship?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Not a chance in hell. The ship belongs to me.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: That's too bad. Maybe if I help you lose that arm of yours during this battle, that'll wake up a part of your humanity?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Chief Mate! Stay back, don't do anything. Let's see how much of a difference there is between us and these monsters claiming to be human.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: You too Skadi, don't snatch my mark. This hunt is mine. And I need to... let off a little bit of steam.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Hunting, must be done.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Purpose, to mold the environment.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You, are rich in nutrients.
attributes.name: Seaborn
